evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, as evidenced by preliminary historical dynamic data prior to the event.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew is resistant to defeaters, as alternative causes have been ruled out based on the preliminary historical dynamic data and crew reports from the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, including miscommunication and lack of coordination impacting crew performance.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and observable within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical dynamic under test 0 preliminary phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands potential defeaters based on the evidence and context provided by the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA historical dynamic under test 0 preliminary phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA's operational protocols and historical test data from 12-25.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, as evidenced by preliminary historical dynamic data prior to the event.

assumptions: The continuation beyond the TRP despite communication attempts indicates a breakdown in coordination among crew.
The trainee driver’s decision to stop and hand over control reflects observable communication and coordination dynamics.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing procedural errors or incidents, or if the incident was solely due to procedural deviation without coordination failure.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 shows active communication and coordination attempts among crew and tug operators, but the pushback continued beyond the designated stop point causing a collision, indicating a communication/coordination breakdown supporting the claim.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing procedural deviation from coordination failure; some actions may reflect procedural errors rather than communication breakdown.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, including miscommunication and lack of coordination impacting crew performance.

assumptions: The described interactions reflect communication/coordination breakdown relevant to the incident
The incident's key features include miscommunication and coordination failures as described
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination without impact on performance
If procedural deviations rather than communication breakdown better explained the incident
